main.name: Alex Wang
main.description: I'm a student at the University of Pittsburgh planning to major in Computer Science and minor in Economics and Philosophy
main.bio: I am currently looking for a Software Engineering internship or research position for Summer 2021 that will allow me to continue to further my technical and soft skills and gain some valuable work experience. When I am not coding or doing coursework, I spend my time either lifting, hiking, or cooking.
main.contactmessage: Send me a message, I'll get back to you within 24 hours

resume.skillmessage: I am always looking for opportunities to build upon my prior skills and pick up new ones

education.description: Current first year student at the school of Computing and Information. Some topics I'm interested in include blockchain, machine learning, game theory, and HCI.

work.title: Software Developer
work.description: Created an eCommerce mobile app for a nonprofit coffee company under the PittServes program. Communicated closely with the client to match specifications. Utilized React Native and the Paypal API for a clean and secure user experience.

work.title: Pro Player
work.description: I competed on the professional level and won multiple online cash tournaments which improved my team building skills and sharpened my competitive spirit. I also owned and managed my team, growing our Twitter page to 15,000 followers.

projects.title: Resu.Me
projects.category: Developed the REST API with Express for the mobile and web application that won the Steelhacks 2021 beginner track. Also worked on the website's frontend making sure it seemlessly integrated with the API properly.

projects.title: Building New Hope App
projects.category: Created an eCommerce mobile application for a nonprofit coffee company with React Native and the Expo framework. Included features such as tab based navigation, splash screen, modal view, and checkout via the Paypal API.

projects.title: Chess
projects.category: This was my first project I completed shortly after my first semester. I utilized Maven and Java OOP design patterns to create a fully functional Chess emulator on the command line.

projects.title: Phonebook
projects.category: A CRUD web application I made using React, Express, and MongoDB. It allows users to provide their credentials and will store only the validated phone numbers. Implemented filtering for parsing through a larger set of people
